remote_yield(++Peer)

Explicitly yield to the remote peer Peer
Peer
Remote peer (atom)

Description

If Peer is a valid current remote peer, this predicate will cause the control to be transfer to that peer, i.e. the ECLiPSe will yield to the remote side. This predicate returns when ECLiPSe side resumes control. If the remote side initiates disconnection while it has control, remote_yield/1 will abort after the disconnection.

Fail Conditions

Peer is not a valid current remote peer.

Resatisfiable

No.

Exceptions

(peer_abort_disconnected)
Peer has disconnected.
(peer_abort_error)
Some internal error has occured (this should be reported as an ECLiPSe bug to the ECLiPSe team).

See Also

remote_connect / 3, remote_disconnect / 1
